oai:clarin-pl.eu:11321/15;2014-09-30T13:07:50Z;hdl_11321_3;hdl_11321_4;IOBBER;Radziszewski, Adam;IOBBER is a chunker for Polish. Its job is to recognise syntactic phrases (chunks) in Polish text.
The name comes from IOB tags that are assigned to tokens to represent chunks (strictly speaking, we use IOB2 representation).
Here is an example sentence annotated with NP and VP chunks:;2012-04-18;toolService;http://hdl.handle.net/11321/15;pol;GNU LGPL 3.0;http://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl.html;PUB;downloadable_files_count: 0;Wrocław University of Technolgy;Wrocław University of Technolgy;http://nlp.pwr.wroc.pl/redmine/projects/iobber/wiki

notes:
IOBBER is a chunker for Polish. Its job is to recognise syntactic phrases (chunks) in Polish text.
The name comes from IOB tags that are assigned to tokens to represent chunks (strictly speaking, we use IOB2 representation).
Here is an example sentence annotated with NP and VP chunks:
title: IOBBER
